Description: Body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery mug; discoloured white slip; interior: glazed streaky black; at top, trace of added white band above single added red band; lower down, single white band then single red band above traces of three faded white bands; at bottom of sherd, single red band; exterior: painted decoration consisting of female figure to left (lower body in a long streaky black and red chiton with paryphe with slanting strokes); on left, part of undetermined object, possibly in figure's hand; below, two dilute bands.
Curator's comments: The number '855' is written in pencil on the interior surface. Lemos describes this sherd as belonging to the Group of Worshippers. According to her, a worshipper is depicted on the exterior. The main vase of this group is the St. Petersburg chalice from Berezan (Lemos 1991, no. 964). Most of the vases in this group display a mixture of techniques consisting female figures in outline and dancing komasts in black-figure. Lemos identifies the sherd as coming from a chalice, but the shape is distinctly that of a mug. For parallels, see British Museum 1888,0601.499.h.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 126, p. 131, p. 292, no. 900, pl. 120)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1927) (phase 2)
